document_data.caption: Shuruppak, the Reaper
document_data.name: Shuruppak
document_data.mainbody: '''Lord Shuruppak''', or '''"the Reaper"''', was the once-[[Chosen]] of [[Gilgeam]] and the deity's deadly right hand. After Gilgeam was slain, Shuruppak became a wandering murderer, killing many in the name of [[Unther]].
document_data.Description: Shuruppak dressed in black robes and concealed the top half of his face in an infamous red half-mask in the shape of a skull he skillfully wielded a wickedly sharp [[greatsword]].
document_data.Personality: In Shuruppak's mind, he truly was "the Reaper", a moniker he attained while serving [[Gilgeam]].
document_data.Possessions: Shuruppak wore a unique set of ''[[Shuruppak's plate|full plate mail]]'' that was bestowed upon him by Gilgeam himself.
document_data.History:
During Shurupprak's long service to Gilgeam he only failed him once. After being ordered to bring in [[the Enclave]], a powerful cabal of wizards based in the [[Greenfields (Unther)|Greenfields]], Shuruppak managed to kill several of their members before being driven back.

In the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, Shuruppak tried to quell rioting in [[Messemprar]] by taking hostages and staging public executions of them.

During the [[Time of Troubles]], in the {{YearlinkName|1358}}, Shuruppak's god Gilgeam was slain by [[Tiamat]]. With Gilgeam's death, Shuruppak was stripped of his [[Chosen]] status and lost what remained of his sanity, going rogue.

By the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, Shuruppak still wandered throughout [[Unther]] slaying all he perceived as enemies of himself or Unther. Both the [[Church of Tiamat]] and the [[Red Wizards of Thay]] were actively trying to recruit him at this time.

The last sighting of Shuruppak was on [[Midsummer]] of the {{YearlinkName|1375}}.<ref>{{Cite dragon/358/Volo's Guide: War upon the Sands|71}}
